description: Woodbine Racetrack (Woodbine) is Canada’s premier Thoroughbred racetrack located in Toronto, Ontario. Woodbine hosts Canada's most famous Thoroughbred races including The Queen's Plate, The Ricoh Woodbine Mile and the Pattison Canadian International. Guests can enjoy a variety of delicious foods from casual to fine dining, along with many enjoyable additional experiences at the racetrack. Please note, amenities, including dining may be impacted by COVID-19. Please visit Woodbine.com for more information. Woodbine Racetrack is not affiliated with Casino Woodbine. Reviews and comments for the casino should be submitted on their unique TripAdvisor page.

reviews.title: Complete Day of Fun
text: My family and I got our passports just so we could go to Woodbine! We walked in to one of the largest Hall of Fame displays we have ever seen at a racetrack. Not many people stopped to notice it but it is a rare jewel!

They have a Stella Artois horn instead of a live bugler. Its a pretty cool reaction to see someone make it go off. There are plenty of food options all around the track. The Carvery was pretty good. Lots of places to sit as well as walk around.
There is also a huge casino attached! Looks like they are making it even bigger so prepare yourself.
Overall a great day for the family!

reviews.title: Find a way to go
text: This is a must for any UK horserace fans travelling to Canada. It makes Ascot look second or third rate. Clean, with plenty of room and food outlets, easy access to the paddock, a fascinating hall of fame, simulcasts, casinos and more. It's all presented with typical Canadian laid-back efficiency.

reviews.title: Fun day out , lovely staff
text: Came here for a family day out at the races. The facilities at this racecourse are vast and plenty. Lovely options for dining and we ourselves enjoyed a meal at the Stella Artois terrace. Staff all lovely and very helpful.

reviews.title: Worst time ever!!!
text: Good morning. Normally I have great time at the race track. It was the Kings Plate. I waited 30 minutes to be served at one of the bars. The bartenders wouldn't even look at me. So asked one of them if they could serve me. They took offense and didn't not serve me. I went to another bar in the establishment and bout two beers. When the bartenders at the previous bar saw me with drinks because my friends were still at that stop. They lied and said I was being obnoxious and got the police to escort me. I was so embarrassed. I never swore or was disrespectful. I will never go to would race track again. So 😞!

reviews.title: Woodbine A Tradition , A Place of Memories
text: Admission and parking are free. Escalators are available to the climate controlled grand stand to view the racing.  Part of the Grandstand offers outdoor seating.  There is a fee to enter the Grandstand area to view the "Kings Plate" formerly the "Queens Plate"  which is held in August of each year.  The seating area , the common areas , and the washrooms are all clean.  The Race Track is very secure and safe place. There is a Food Court area , as well as a Tim Hortons and a restaurant.  The are lots of betting machines as well as a number of wickets for your wagering convenience.  The problem is I could find only one machine to cash your tickets at.  If you don't want to stand in a long line to cash your tickets at a machine , you can stand in a long line to cash your tickets at the wickets/mutuals.  The trick to avoid long lines at the machine or wickets is to cash your tickets between the races a few minutes after the previous race. The staff are friendly and well trained.

reviews.title: Mayhem, disorganized, sloppy, slow, badly run poker room.
text: Poker room only.

Ask  3 supervisors and you'll get 3 different answers. Herman and Richard are the only 2 poker (out of 100+) dealers that know what they're doing. One dealer yesterday was so slow, 6 of the 9 players asked to be transferred to another table. She couldnt split a chopped pot, nor could she figure out how to distribute the money in a 3 way all-in hand. Be prepared to be dealt 5 hands in half an hour. Another dealer calls out the cards, then asks: (there's 2 eights on the board) "so who's got the 8 ? "

Very unprofessionally run. Wait times can be up to 4 hours!!! No call in but if you know someone that knows someone, you can get on a table as  soon as you walk in if there's a seat open. As in life, its who you know, not what you know.

reviews.title: Upgraded Woodbine casino
text: The casino has expanded and it's the size of an airport. As usual the coffee and drinks are free but the machines are usually out of order the same goes for cashiers and Tito machines. Long line ups is common and expect slow service. The place is so big but no escalators to help you across. There is no shuttle bus. The place feels dangerous with minimum security. There are no maps or staff to guide you around this place so expect to get lost. The old casino still looks the same and it's over loaded with slots inches apart. it's so crowded it's almost impossible to get anything. Nothing is cheap and usually overpriced. Any breakdowns could lead you to been stuck waiting for up to one hour or two including jackpots to be paid. The place looks under staffed. The parking is terrible you could be waiting a long time for a spot. The whole place is set up to be all high limit. The setup is terrible with tables and slots mixed into one room. Player benefits are terrible and comps are terrible and almost non existent. The horse racing area still looks like a dump. Smoking areas are almost non existent and very far.Its just not a pleasant place to gamble your money.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
text: First timers at the race track and it was amazing. Every employee was extremely nice and helpful. Cindy at guest services was more than friendly and helped us to the restaurant. The food was great. Thomas came and explained all the betting, took us down to the paddock, helped us bet, gave us front row seats, and was incredibly helpful and genuine. We even got a picture in the winners circle. We all felt like VIP’s!!
It was the best experience. Maybe it was a slow day (Friday afternoon) but every employee was truly amazing.

reviews.title: POKER ROOM $20 RAKE SCAM!!
text: I am specifically reviewing the poker room that recently opened up that offers:
The people that work here are predatory and seemingly send the inexperienced players to the 5/10 table to avoid the wait times.
I noticed on a Saturday 1pm 2-3hr for 1/3 & 2/5.
The most EGREGIOUS and borderline ILLEGAL activity I’ve EVER seen at a casino is a 10%, $20 max rake.
Even Vegas only has a rake of 10% and $5..
…  and people nearly lost their minds when they try to increase it to $6
It is nearly impossible to make a profit if they take up to $20 for all action post flop.
There is no rake if there is no flop.
Do not come to this casino if you want to play live poker and actually have a chance at winning!!!
Go to elements Branford… the lines are honestly not that long. Now that all the Toronto people are going to Woodbine, and I’ve actually noticed quite a rise in rookies for some reason…. 😏
Other than Brantford I think the only other one is Niagara that has live poker… feel free to go there, I have no affiliation with Brantford CasinoI & actually live in Kitchener

reviews.title: Save your money!
text: I was playing slots, I’d say 1/3 were shut down, or being repaired. It’s quite a walk to the casino if you go by bus. You have to go to get your drinks food etc, no one comes to you anymore. I found the machines were tighter than the bark on the trees. One thing I was truly surprised at, is they still have pay phones!

reviews.title: Don’t even bother!
text: Why is the casino falling apart with new owners?  Don’t they care?  I walked in there today and line up for Rewards was soooooo long!  Also trying to find your way back out the door is impossible....too many machines which of half are broken down, smells of bad odor everywhere you walk.  Machines are crammed, workers just laugh.  New owners should take a trip to Windsor casino so they know how to do it right.  What a difference, I look forward to going there even though I live in Toronto.  I’m ashamed that a city as big as Toronto has the dumpiest Casino.  Yes I know it’s being renovated but what about space?  No class!

reviews.title: extremely low class!
text: I would not go back! It looks like a warehouse with ugly, old gaming tables. It was so disgusting I did not even consider playing. It’s shameful how a city this alive and beautiful can’t get a nice and classy casino going. i Thought with new owners it would be better but it is definitely much worse.

reviews.title: Penurious, cheap and chintzy casino
text: We recently tried Woodbine on the 3rd floor with their own new players called which they call one rewards which separates it from the total rewards card.

Let me start the the 3rd floor slots and tables gaming floor is cheaply done in a chintzy fashion. The tables they have for eating is manned by 2 servers that are very slow in taking and cleaning the tables. There is a makeshift bar with a refrigerated showcase. All food comes from downstairs. I am not even sure if they had a sink there at the bar. Tables are not cleaned quickly and decor is dollar store type.  A players lounge for  high rollers usually has some sofas to sit on and TV also. etc.

We were informed that the food was comped at this level- unfortunately this is not true. They check your card to see if you have any money sitting in it from your points and that is the one you use for the meals. The menu  is limited and took a long time almost 30 minutes from the time the servers get your order, check your money on the card from the front, and get the food downstairs and bring it up via elevator and the food is cold. For  a high roller room this is poor and shows no customer appreciation for the people that have easily lost  tons of money. Over and above that, the casino hosts are poorly trained to handle requests. Fallsview casino hosts for all players, irrespective of blue, gold and platinum are treated courteously, with respect and there is no nickel and dining with respect from the comps. The host who told us how much we had was okay but after our group had ordered it still had to be verified again by the front host who did not know what she is doing. The walkers also do not know much and if you have a problem with machine, it takes 3-4  attendants before it is rectified. The free fruit plates are not very clean, probably leftover from the buffet downstairs. The health department should check this floor if it is up to standards for food, drinks.

The woodbine 3rd floor machines are tightly wound,and differently calibrated. Sometimes when you get the bonus lines it does not run the bonus. We have played these machines and know when the bonus is to run. SO if you want to waste your money, this is the place.
you are better playing on the first floor. Payback is also on the lower side, even if you are playing high. Card dealers also are a bit stiff so we did not bother to go back and play there.

I know the new owners are there like any businessman to get their money back  since they are putting the hotel, entertainment and other buildings up, but that have over 20 years to recoup their investment and gouging the customers right now will leave  a bad taste in their mouth.
We went to Mohawk also which is also being run by an investor and they were really empty, especially the high roller room. The  card tables they newly set up was occupied 10%, with their expansion.

Woodbine is convenient but gaming here has gone top greedy. Staff is poorly trained in  all levels. Washrooms are sometimes closed, and always dirty and filthy. There should be some modicum of health standards in the washrooms that should be enforced with the volume of people they have.
We are casino players and we know we cannot always win, but we do like to have good food, a nice lounge and the comps like in Vegas.
Mohegan Sun is coming to Ontario and maybe they will show how things are done is casinos.
Skip Woodbine and Mohawk, it was better run when the Ontario gaming did it. Be smart.

reviews.title: Lunch at Woodbine Racetrack
text: It's an experience you should try at least once. To watch the races while you eat was fun and entertaining. The food on the other hand was not as pleasant. We ordered off the menu was not the greatest and it's also a minimum of $25/pp.

I ordered the egg frittata and it came to me over cooked, brown on top and the egg tasted like hollow rubber. I was not happy. My husband ordered the chicken and waffles. He said the the chicken was over fried and way too crunchy! Not the best experience for food.

The service was ok, not the best. It was like the waiter didn't know to take the order  like it was his first time as a waiter. Everything was delayed...from our water to our drinks and to our food. Even getting the bill took forever.

Overall experience...we loved watching the races and placing our bets. Food could be better. We did have a choice on the buffet, however the day we went was the day they increased their lunch prices to holiday lunch price and we were notified the day before.
I would go back just to watch the races but good wise...I think I would go sit out by the food court area, at least the fried chicken there looked decent and not overpriced and overcooked.

reviews.title: Poor customer Service
text: WASTED OVER 30 MINUTES OF MY TIME WAITING FOR SERVICE WHEN I COULD BE PLAYING! The Multi-game machine with roulette, sicbo, craps and paigao was so slow, as well troublesome! There was an error on my sicbo game asking me to get an attendant when I won. The concierge button on the machine does nothing, even pressed all the concierge buttons beside me. I waited and looked around for 20 minutes in the area until I saw a staff member in red. She was cranky and unwelcoming. Luckily she was willing to help me page tech. The tech took over 10 minutes to come fix the sicbo machine. When he came, there was no acknowledgement or conversation. He went to the back, fixed it and walked away. I will not come back, I rather go back to Port Perry, Rama or Fallsview.

reviews.title: Not pay OUT
text: play Max and pay 10$ after 500$
another player play only with 20$ and play 5C$ and make 20 $
Then never play MAX

reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
text: Customer service is slipping badly. Ticket redemption machines are out of order or out of funds all over the casino even in the room today. Line ups at the cashiers is unacceptable. More and more slots are out of service, finding a slot attendant is very difficult, The line ups for promotion redemption are extreme. The west entrance was open today for the first time in our last 4 visits. Cut the visit short to frustrating.  Niagara casinos are looking to be worth the drive. I did come out ahead today but the experience was sub par and not worth the frustration.

reviews.title: Ripoff
text: This place doesn't payout. It used to be better when the Ontario government owned it. The new owners have to pay for major expansion and will not pay you till they recoup their money. May be in the future they will start paying out. The e-table games upstairs are Ripoff. Hi to Niagra or Rama.

reviews.title: Broken redemption machines
text: Was at woodbine casino 6 weeks ago 90% of the redemption machines where shut down went back today Oct 13th a lot of the redemption machines are still down. Makes you wonder if they keep these machines down so people who want to cash there tickets in will get frustrated in long line ups and go out and lose the money. Never been to a more frustrating casino.

reviews.title: Nice Track, Lots of Options
text: I really liked visiting this track. It has everything there! There are many options inside for eating, and I recommend the roast beef sandwich. It was amazing. And there are betting windows/kiosks everywhere, easy to get to even with 2 minutes to post. We liked being about to visit the paddock before races and the winners circle after. Parking was a breeze, easy in and out. And having the Casino on the same property meant we had more ways to lose our money. :) Fun track, come visit.

reviews.title: Dinner
text: The Lobster and Prime Rib was an excellent deal and more than satisfied the palate for the price paid.
Also did some gambling, which has many many options.

reviews.title: Company Event/Lunch
text: Delicious lunch buffet with a wide variety choices to suit any palette.  Exceptional dining area over looking the track with easy access to outdoor stands.

reviews.title: To large
text: Although its meant to accommodate a lot of people, i found it easy to get list inside.

Machines seem to be scattered every which way ( slots) . Im use to the smaller venues but it was ok. I came out ahead . Did not bet on the horses today. Last time  here was around 10 years ago. I live closer to rama .

reviews.title: Very low class and rundown place
text: We live in Toronto and decided to check this place. Got there around 730/8pm, on a Saturday, the escalator was out of service and going up we could see that the escalator steps were quite dirty. The slot machine room was small and they had packed all the slot machine they could physically shove in that place, without taking into account any design. Everyone was super close to each other the floor was super old and dirty, some guy was going around offering free coffee,the coffees were premade and in foam cups with lids, I mean FOAM cups,really??, Costco business center sells 250 to 400 hot beverage cups for next to nothing something like 10 cents or less, you would think a casino for the money it makes can afford to buy some better cups.The staff offering water and coffee were dressed so cheap looking shirts and pants you would think they were janitors.

The food court was very limited and food quality very bad. The only semi decent restaurant in that building was closed.all in all if we ever decide to go to a casino this place would never be an option.The place was quite depressing and lacked any spark.

reviews.title: Review of 2019 Queen's Plate at Woodbine racetrack
text: I did find much review on the annual Queen's Plate racing event, so here's the review.

There are LOTS of people attending! Races began 12pm, and by 1:30pm we got there, we had to park very far away. You can valet park, there's line up but not tremendous, however wait until you want to leave between 6:30-7:30, the valet line is tremendous, waiting will be 30 minutes and more at the ground floor museum area.
A lot of people do dress up, guys with nice blazer and hat, ladies with pretty dresses and of course, fancy hats. It was a nice scene for Toronto, as it's usually laid back style.
There's men and women fashion contest, but the winners are not most fashionable for sure, it's just fun for participants. Man's winners gets cash, Women's winners get some fashion store gift card.

The building is packed! Every betting machine has average 6-people line up, food court has huge line up, it was a hot day, so even if you just want a soda, line up will be 15 minutes. Tip: 4th floor has no air-conditioning, and least line up for the soda!
After the main Queen's Plate race, the crowd gradually leave. There are concert at the grounds to attract people not to leave at the same time.
BTW, the building has free wifi.
In all, if you are ok with big crowd, you'll like the event.

reviews.title: Went with friends
text: We had reservations for 9 we were spit up into 3 tables.  We were given programs & water.  We went to the buffet, there was a nice selection of salads, meats & fish along with a selection of pickles & condiments.  There were 3 types of buns.  There was a breakfast bar where you could have waffles, or eggs etc.  The hot table had roast pork & roast beef here as potatoes, veggies, salmon & chicken. There was also a dessert table.  It was nice, but expensive for a buffet @ $49.95 + coffee & tea extra!!  When I settled my bill it was $60.00, plus the money I took to play the horse races, an expensive afternoon for sure!

reviews.title: Will not be returning to Woodbine racetrack Champions Lounge
text: Yesterday's "service" in the Champions Lounge was absolutely horrible - completely unacceptable.  There were seven of us.  After waiting about 15 mins. just to place our order for drinks and lunch, our server took our orders.  She was very vague about the menu ("yah..I think so")  were typical responses.

We then waited another 20 minutes (no exaggeration) to receive the drink order.  The server said the delay was because we ordered on-tap beer which took forever to get poured because the bartenders serve their favourite customers that are sitting at the bar first. lesson learned - order bottled beer.
Our next round of drinks took another 15 minutes to arrive.
I don't know how this place can have such poor staff - they don't seem to care.
We observed our sever standing by the staff area, watching the TV screens (while we were still waiting for our orders). Yesterday's service was so bad it was almost funny.
Never again.  We are done with that place.  Which is a shame - we used to love going to the racetrack and having a nice lunch, with reasonably good service.

reviews.title: Enjoy This Outing For A Meal, Horse racing and Casino
text: I had the pleasure of visiting this establishment for the Mother's Day Weekend and enjoyed it again. The buffet lunch was a bit on the expensive side and could have had a few more food choices, but since it was more about the company than the meal we had a good time. What I like about this place is that you can enjoy the races while you are having a comfortable buffet meal and when you are done if you are so inclined, you can venture off to the casino. They have really enhanced this establishment since I last went. They now have 3 floors of casino play depending on what your interest is. It was a great day out overall and even though it seemed to have some construction going on in the main casino area, I still consider this place to be a "HIT" and would definitely go back again.

reviews.title: Spend an Afternoon in the Sun...
text: ...watching a horse race or three.  A pleasant venue with comfortable enough seating.

I'd suggest you avoid the food court.  The flavors may be OK, but there's a pervasive odor of rancid Chinese food.  Like a late night walk past the cheapest joint in Chinatown just before they get ready to scrub down the kitchen.

reviews.title: Worst place ever
text: Made many reviews of how bad this place is but today proved it. Upon arrival we learned the machines to redeem your ticket for any money you won where down you had to line up at the cashiers window to get your money 1 to 2 hour wait. Then the slots broke down if you wanted to cash out you had to wait for an attendant to bring your money wife waited 2 hours 5 minutes to get paid. This place was total confusion no plan in place for computer problems. Since this place has changed hands this place is a total disaster. All they want is your money no customer satisfaction. We where told by casino staff its not our problem you will just have to wait.

reviews.title: Our Annual Event Never Disappoints!
text: this is an annual event with my family. there's about 20 of us and we reserve the sofa are at the Stella Artois Terrace. WE had a large section with comfortable sofas. the staff was outstanding!! they took such good care of us including taking us down to see the stables and horses. we loved the food and the environment. it was a perfect day. a couple of the family members visited the casino and won some money in the penny machines. The only downside, is they charge 10.00 per person to enter the terrace, which seems unfair since we all ordered lots of drinks and food.  oh and one other thing...you have to reserve seats online and we could not reserve 20 seats so we had to select groups of 4. we tried calling to see if we could combine the seats to one area and left endless number of messages with NO call back. in desperation, we somehow got the restaurant manager who was amazing and took care of our seating requirements. otherwise we loved it!!

reviews.title: Birthday celebration at Stella Artois was wonderful
text: We ate at Stella Artois patio. The food was delicious and the servers were efficient and friendly.
Special thanks to server, Teresa who went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. 5 stars

reviews.title: So much fun.
text: While staying in Toronto my wife and i decided to spend the afternoon at the races and we are so glad we did. This is the first time we have ever been to the races in Canada. The weather was great we were seated in front of the winners post and we had an excellent meal and drinks. The staff made it a great afternoon for us helping us with our betting and we even managed to win some races. We thoroughly enjoyed our afternoon and would recommend it to anyone wanting to try something different.

reviews.title: So much for the Sport of Kings.
text: Woodbine racetrack is now a low rent casino. The floor space dedicated to slots has increased so much  that previous vantage points for actually viewing the track is severely curtailed. The so-called "Champions bar" has no windows facing the track but a series of TVs and automated "wagering machines" that makes for a sad, and hollowed out cavern, designed to separate customers from their money in as fast a fashion as possible. Without the slightest interest in entertainment, cuisine or the majesty of the horses, Woodbine is now on my "must miss" list for things to do in Toronto.

reviews.title: Fun time at the races
text: We went for the first time in many years. The whole facility is fresh and offers much in the way of experiences.

We didn’t know where to eat so went to customer service desk. Laura suggested the patio, Stella Artois. She escorted us to the 3 rd level personally. We were lead to a table with full view of the tracks and it was on the finish line! Awesome view and comfortable seats. We ordered drinks and food which arrived promptly.
The food was tasty and portions were large. Our server was polite, professional and friendly.

reviews.title: RIP OFF RACE TRACK
text: Stay far away from Woodbine Race Track.  They are as crooked as a dogs hind leg.  They are impossible to handicap and  it shows in their average pay offs.  You would be better trying to  win money in their Casino.   DO NOT BET ON THEIR PONIES!

reviews.title: Dirty
text: The casino is okay but the choice of food and drink are pretty bad. The outside grounds are unbelievably dirty with cigarette butts everywhere.  I would expect more care to be taken. It nice that there is no smoking inside but clean up your property. I probably would not go back

reviews.title: Mums 70th birthday!
text: I can’t say enough about our wonderful day yesterday at Woodbine racetrack to celebrate my mom‘s 70th birthday. From the second I started making the reservation, everyone was so incredibly helpful in making this day so special. Vanessa was the person I was contacting back-and-forth about our reservation, and she could not do enough to make sure all 24 of us were seated together and in a way that made it accessible for my mom‘s wheelchair.    We had the perfect spot and after much moving around she was able to accommodate all of us on the same level side-by-side.  The waitress was great and even with all 7 little kids kept us happy and attended to through the whole 7 hours (sorry I can’t remember her name 😔)!

The other person I want to highlight is Jan, the lady who gave us the paddock tour, as well as the special gift of going to the announcers booth that my parents, aunt and uncle received as part of one of the birthday options. She was so friendly and so  helpful, giving us such an enjoyable experience. My mom really had the most wonderful time and it’s thanks to these ladies in particular for going over and above to make it perfect. We enjoyed it so much and even with the 7 kids lasted the whole day of racing and can’t wait to come back. We are already planning our next visit! Thank you for helping us create a beautiful day of memories! It’s the little things that make these events so special and these two added so many little touches through their kindness ❤️

reviews.title: Queen Plate not impressed
text: We love going to the track and betting on the horse.  Been to a couple of them this on it ok.  They have the casino and we went on the Queen Plate day which it the reason I think we didn’t like it.  It was get to dress up, take pictures and listen to music.  But it was so crowed.  Hard to find a spot to eat. Try to see the horse up close.  Lines were so slow for everything.  We couldn’t appreciate the experience.

reviews.title: Out for an evening of fun and gambling
text: This is our 1st visit to this place and was totally impressed!
Loved the horseracing and the huge casino.
If you are out looking for fun,excitement and to win some money...this is the place!
